issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

components.name: webhdfs
components.description: WebHDFS: HTTP REST API for HDFS

fields.description: Operations like {code:java}curl -i -L"http://<HOST>:<PORT>/webhdfs/v1/<PATH>?user.name=0123&op=OPEN"{code} that directed to DataNode fail because of not reading the suggested domain pattern from the configuration.
fields.summary: In WebHDFS numeric usernames do not work with DataNode

comments.body:
GitHub user ramtinb opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/94

    HDFS-10382 In WebHDFS numeric usernames do not work with DataNode

    In WebHDFS for cat operation, we have 2 sequential HTTP requests.
    The first HTTP request is handled by NN and the second one by DN.
    Unlike the NN, the DN is not using the suggested domain pattern from the configuration!

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/ramtinb/hadoop feature/HDFS-10382

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/94.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #94
    
----
commit 6cbb8f60702b8c3211e52e71681fc8d981fe0525
Author: Ramtin Boustani <rboustani@us.ibm.com>
Date:   2016-05-10T00:05:05Z

    HDFS-10382 In WebHDFS numeric usernames do not work with DataNode

----

This message was automatically generated.
I'm very hesitant towards this patch because Bad Things(tm) happen if numeric user names ever need to be resolved at the system level. (hint: they aren't supported by POSIX.)

Thanks [~aw] for your comment. I think you are right but this patch just tries to fix HDFS-4983 problem in reading domain pattern from the configuration and even this problem can happen for non-numeric usernames.
